required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plethysmographic and Acoustic Respiration Rate Clinical Data Collection
clinical_study.official_title: Plethysmographic and Acoustic Respiration Rate Clinical Data Collection

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this clinical investigation is to collect high-resolution pulse oximetry, RRp, and RAM data in pediatric subjects for the purpose of algorithm optimization and to build a database of representative pulse oximetry and respiratory signal profiles for patients in this population.

primary_outcome.measure: Collection of high-resolution pulse oximetry and RAM data in pediatric subjects
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The objective of this clinical investigation is to collect high-resolution pulse oximetry and acoustic signals in pediatric subjects for the purpose of algorithm optimization and to build a database of representative pulse oximetry and respiratory signal profiles for patients in this population.

arm_group.description: The subjects will be enrolled in the test group and will receive Pulse Oximeter with respiration rate sensor to examine the respiration rate.

intervention.intervention_name: Pulse Oximeter with respiration rate sensor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age: 0 to 5 years old
- Fully developed skin
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with skin abnormalities at the planned application sites that would interfere with sensor application.
- Subjects with pre-existing conditions and/or co-morbidities that would prohibit them from participating in the study due to unacceptable risks to their health and well-being, as determined by the Principal Investigator (PI).
- Subjects deemed not suitable for the study at the discretion of the investigator

facility.name: Medical Office of Mohammad T. Bailony
